title: [Large-Scale] Sustainable Society Through Groundwater Resources: Constructivist-Based Backward Design Course

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of fundamental earth science concepts (water cycle, stratigraphic structure)
context.additional_context: Intensive weekend workshops for workplace learners, focusing on field cases for practical, job-linked training

learning_goals: Learners can visually explain groundwater formation processes and aquifer structures.
Learners can identify three or more major causes of groundwater pollution in daily life and industrial settings.
Learners can propose two corporate-level action plans for groundwater conservation.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
